28.text: Hello. Tonight sees the first match

30.text: of our short seasonal contest for alumni of some of

34.text: the UK's leading universities and university colleges.

37.text: No doubt it seemed like a good idea at the time when 14 teams

40.text: agreed to try to uphold the dignity of their institution,

43.text: and ten matches from now, one of them will be crowned series champion.

47.text: Their prize will be nothing more than the honour of victory,

50.text: to be savoured over the last of the mince pies and a glass from

54.text: the bottle of medium sherry that last year's winners didn't quite finish.

58.text: There are only two rules for taking part.

60.text: Players must have graduated from the institution they represent,

64.text: and since then, they must have made something of their careers.

67.text: As we will see, the second rule is applied pretty loosely.

70.text: With 14 teams competing, there will be

72.text: seven winners in the first round,

74.text: but only the four teams with the highest winning scores

287.text: There are ten points for starter questions,

293.text: Each correctly answered starter earns the team a set of

296.text: bonus questions worth a possible 15 points.

299.text: For these, the team can and should confer,

302.text: with the captain giving the answer.

304.text: There being 14 teams, there are seven first-round matches,

307.text: but only the four winning teams with the high scores will

311.text: go through to the next stage, so my advice is - get on with it.
